perturbation.original_text:
3. To the extent, if any, that provision of this Agreement
conflicts with or differs from any provision of the Agreement, such provision
of this Second Amendment shall prevail and govern for all purposes and in all
respects.
perturbation.changed_text: 3. To the extent, if any, that any term or condition in this Agreement is unclear, the parties will attempt to resolve such unclear provision by good faith negotiation. If the Parties are unable to come to an agreement through such negotiations, the original agreement shall take precedence.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces ambiguity by contradicting the precedence of the Second Amendment. The original text explicitly states the Second Amendment prevails in case of conflicts. The modified version suggests negotiation in case of unclear terms, but states the original agreement takes precedence if the parties cannot agree on the meaning, effectively nullifying the amendments priority.

perturbation.original_text:
4. Except as modified hereby, the Agreement and its terms and
provisions are hereby ratified and confirmed for all purposes and in all
respects.
perturbation.changed_text: 4. Except as explicitly modified hereby, the Agreement and its terms are believed to be ratified and confirmed for all purposes and in all respects. Further documentation may be required to fully confirm agreement.
perturbation.explanation: The original text confirms ratification except as modified. The changed text introduces doubt about full ratification. It suggests further documentation may be required which contradicts the definitive statement of the original text. It makes the agreement unstable. The use of the words 'believed to be ratified' weakens this assertion.

perturbation.original_text:
WHEREAS, PCQ and ABW have executed that certain Co-Branding
Agreement dated October 11, 1996, as amended on December 10, 1996 (as so
amended, the "Agreement");
perturbation.changed_text:
WHEREAS, PCQ and ABW may have executed a Co-Branding
Agreement, potentially dated October 11, 1996, with potential amendments on or around December 10, 1996 (hereinafter referred to as the "Potential Agreement");
perturbation.explanation: The original text states that PCQ and ABW executed a Co-Branding Agreement. The changed text undermines this foundation by suggesting they 'may have' executed such agreement. The dates of the agreements also are questioned. The modified version introduces uncertainty by replacing concrete facts with conjecture, contradicting the firm statement in the original version.
